parallel
Class LimitedTimeTaskExecutor

java.lang.Object
  parallel.LimitedTimeTaskExecutor
public class LimitedTimeTaskExecutor
extends java.lang.Object

A class that allows its users to execute tasks (object that describe some computation that must implement the TaskObject interface) for a limited time, starting them in different threads than the thread that called the execute(task) method. Thread-pooling is implemented so that if a thread previously created is available, it is re-used rather than starting a new thread for each call of the execute(task) method. Long-running tasks are given lower and lower priority (but cannot be abruptly ended as the destroy() family of thread methods has been deprecated since jdk 1.2.) The class provides a useful tool for limiting function evaluations in the popt4jlib library; see the source and documentation of the classes popt4jlib.LimitedTimeEvalFunction and popt4jlib.FunctionEvaluationTask The tasks must of course be thread-safe, and must not be manipulated in any way from another thread after they have been submitted to the LimitedTimeTaskExecutor class for execution prior to finishing execution. The class itself is also thread-safe (per-se).

Title: popt4jlib

Description: A Parallel Meta-Heuristic Optimization Library in Java

Copyright: Copyright (c) 2011

Company:

Version:
1.0
Author:
Ioannis T. Christou

Constructor Detail

LimitedTimeTaskExecutor

public LimitedTimeTaskExecutor(long maxresponsetime2wait)
constructor for the LimitedTimeTaskExecutor class.

Parameters:
maxresponsetime2wait - long the maximum time allowed to pass for the task.run() method of any TaskObject object to finish (in milliseconds).
Method Detail

getNumThreads

public int getNumThreads()
return the total number of threads created by this LimitedTimeTaskExecutor.

Returns:
int

execute

public boolean execute(TaskObject task)
executes the TaskObject argument in a different thread, and waits for _msecs2wait milliseconds for the run() method of the task object to finish. If it does, then it returns true, otherwise it returns false. The TaskObject task must be such so that its method isDone() does not return true until the computation of run() has been completed.

Parameters:
task - TaskObject
Returns:
boolean
